stories.text:
I use to check new jobs every week to know how requirements and salaries are changing, this year I've noticed a quite dramatic surge in Cryto related jobs with really good salaries, three years ago I interviewed for three crypto related companies and none of them survived, they just got some investment and disappeared. Since then and after the massive surge of crypto miners mafias last year I ended up hating the lack of transparency, environmental ethics and their dirty marketing therefore I wouldn't accept a job on that field.
Would you accept a job in Crypto? I wonder if I'm missing something?
stories.title: Would you accept a job in Crypto?

stories.text:
Close to getting an offer for a late stage (800M raised, close to IPO) fintech co.

Going for a senior PM role.

Salary range given is 150-200: I’m aiming for 170+.

Sign up bonus: didn’t specific amount but will aim for 20-40k, pending salary.

Performance bonus: aiming for 20%

What I’m not sure about is equity. Given this is not FANNG. I’ve seen some crazy amount of grant - 80-100/yr on level. But not sure what’s a good amount for this kind of startup is like.

Looking for advice on equity as well as other parts of the offer.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to negotiate offer for late stage startup?
